headline.main: Charles M. Schulz, 'Peanuts' Creator, Dies at 77

abstract: Charles M Schulz, creator of 'Peanuts' comic strip read by 355 million people worldwide, dies of colon cancer at age 77, hours after final cartoon runs in Sunday newspapers; drew cartoon for nearly half century; final strip, which apppeared on February 13, carried signed farewell; photos; cartoons (L)
snippet: Charles M. Schulz, the creator of ''Peanuts,'' the tender and sage comic strip starring Charlie Brown and Snoopy that is read by 355 million people around the world, died in his sleep on Saturday night at his home in Santa Rosa, Calif., just hours...
